results.title: The Gleaners and I
results.brief_description: Varda focuses her eye on gleaners: those who scour already-reaped fields for the odd potato or turnip. Her investigation leads from forgotten corners of the French countryside to off-hours at the green markets of Paris, following those who insist on finding a use for that which society has cast off, whether out of necessity or activism.
results.description: Varda focuses her eye on gleaners: those who scour already-reaped fields for the odd potato or turnip. Her investigation leads from forgotten corners of the French countryside to off-hours at the green markets of Paris, following those who insist on finding a use for that which society has cast off, whether out of necessity or activism.

results.title: The Girl on the Train
results.creator_credit: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor
results.headline_credit: India and United States of America, 2016
results.brief_description: Rachel Watson, devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor

results.title: The Games
results.brief_description: The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.description:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.
description_for_label:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.

results.title: The Frog Prince
results.brief_description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

results.description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.
description_for_label: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.

results.title: The Fifth Element
results.brief_description: In 2257, a taxi driver is unintentionally given the task of saving a young girl who is part of the key that will ensure the survival of humanity.
results.description: In 2257, a taxi driver is unintentionally given the task of saving a young girl who is part of the key that will ensure the survival of humanity.

results.title: The Favourite
results.headline_credit: Ireland, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah’s cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen’s favourite.

constellations_primary.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_primary.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

constellations_other.name: Power and privilege, monarchy and make-up
constellations_other.description: The upper echelons of society explored through colour, make-up and scandal.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.title: The Fall
results.creator_credit: Absolute Entertainment, Googly Films, Deep Films, Tree Top Films Inc., RadicalMedia, Tarsem Singh, Dan Gilroy, Nico Soultanakis, Eiko Ishioka, Ged Clarke, Lionel Kopp, Ray Leakey and Josh Robertson
results.headline_credit: India and United States of America, 2008
results.brief_description: In a hospital on the outskirts of 1920s Los Angeles, an injured stuntman tells a fellow patient, a little girl with a broken arm, a fantastic story about five mythical heroes. As the stories unfold, the line between fiction and reality blurs.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Absolute Entertainment, Googly Films, Deep Films, Tree Top Films Inc., RadicalMedia, Tarsem Singh, Dan Gilroy, Nico Soultanakis, Eiko Ishioka, Ged Clarke, Lionel Kopp, Ray Leakey and Josh Robertson
results.description: In a hospital on the outskirts of 1920s Los Angeles, an injured stuntman begins to tell a fellow patient, a little girl with a broken arm, a fantastic story about 5 mythical heroes. Thanks to his fractured state of mind and her vivid imagination, the line between fiction and reality starts to blur as the tale advances.
description_for_label: In a hospital on the outskirts of 1920s Los Angeles, an injured stuntman begins to tell a fellow patient, a little girl with a broken arm, a fantastic story about 5 mythical heroes. Thanks to his fractured state of mind and her vivid imagination, the line between fiction and reality starts to blur as the tale advances.

results.title: The Eric Andre Show
results.brief_description: A comedic talk show from an alternate reality featuring unstable hosts, a variety of celebrities—both real and fake—and unusual studio action.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.description: A comedic talk show from an alternate reality featuring unstable hosts, a variety of celebrities—both real and fake—and unusual studio action.

results.title: The Empire Strikes Back
results.creator_credit: Irvin Kershner, Richard Edlund, Ralph McQuarrie, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Rick McCallum, Howard G. Kazanjian, Norman Reynolds, Leigh Brackett, John Mollo and Lawrence Kasdan
results.brief_description: The epic saga continues as Luke Skywalker, in hopes of defeating the evil Galactic Empire, learns the ways of the Jedi from aging master Yoda. But Darth Vader is more determined than ever to capture Luke. Meanwhile, rebel leader Princess Leia, cocky Han Solo, Chewbacca, and droids C-3PO and R2-D2 are thrown into various stages of capture, betrayal and despair.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Irvin Kershner, Richard Edlund, Ralph McQuarrie, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Rick McCallum, Howard G. Kazanjian, Norman Reynolds, Leigh Brackett, John Mollo and Lawrence Kasdan

But Darth Vader is more determined than ever to capture Luke. Meanwhile, rebel leader Princess Leia, cocky Han Solo, Chewbacca, and droids C-3PO and R2-D2 are thrown into various stages of capture, betrayal and despair.
